content: remove marker k 1 place next 70 72 76 sts on hold cast on 13 15 15 sts k 1 slip or remove marker k to next marker slip or remove marker k 1 place next 70 72 76 sts on hold cast on 13 15 15 sts k 1 slip or remove marker k to bor there are 210 220 232 sts on the needles move the bor to under the right sleeve body knit in the round until the body measures 20 2 20 3 19 7 cm or 5 cm less than desired length for the ribbing switch to 4 5 mm needles and knit one round then k 1 p1 for 5 cm bind off in pattern sleeves place the sts that were put on hold on the 5 0 mm needles pick up 7 8 8 sts from the sts that were cast on for the body k 70 72 76 sts pick up 6 7 7 sts that were cast on for the body place a marker in the first stitch of the round there are 83 87 91 sts on the needles k two rounds in the next round decrease 2 sts on the sleeve as follows k 1 ssk k until two sts before the marked stitch k2tog repeat the decrease round 12 13 14 more times every 8th 8th 7th round after the last decrease round there are 57 59 61 sts on the needles k until sleeve measures 55 7 56 8 57 2 cm or 5 cm less than desired length for the ribbing switch to 4 5 mm needles knit one round while k2tog at a random place in that round = 56 58 60 sts then k 1 p 1 for 5 cm bind off in pattern repeat with the other sleeve finishing weave in the ends and block your sweater 6 techniques gsr turn the work slip the next stitch on the left needle purlwise with yarn in front pull the yarn to the back you now have a double stitch on the right needle m1r rs lift the strand between the last and the next stitch from back to front with the left needle knit into the front of the loop to make a right-leaning increase m1r ws lift the strand between the last and the next stitch from front to back with the left needle then purl into the back of the loop to create a right-leaning increase on the right side m1l rs lift the strand between the last and the next stitch from front to back with the left needle then knit into the back of the loop to make a left-leaning increase m1l ws lift the strand between the last and the next stitch from back to front with the left needle then purl into the front of the loop to create a left-leaning increase on the right side k2tog knit two stitches together as one stitch ssk slip one stitch
